message_1: What is the half-life of Thorium-230 in the radioactive decay series of Uranium-238, if it undergoes alpha decay to produce Radium-226? Given the initial amount of Thorium-230 present is 4 milligrams, and after 12.5 days only 1 milligram of Thorium-230 remains.
message_2:
To determine the half-life of Thorium-230, we can use the half-life formula:

N = N0 * (1/2)^(t/T)

where:
N = the final amount of Thorium-230 remaining (1 mg)
N0 = the initial amount of Thorium-230 (4 mg)
t = the time elapsed (12.5 days)
T = the half-life of Thorium-230 (which we want to find)

Rearranging the formula to solve for T, we get:

T = t / (log2(N0/N))

Plugging in the given values:

T = 12.5 days / (log2(4/1))

T = 12.5 days / (log2(4))

T = 12.5 days / 2

T = 6.25 days

The half-life of Thorium-230 in the radioactive decay series of Uranium-238 is 6.25 days.
